title: Deep Water: The Real Story
overview: In the 1980s and 1990s a wave of murders bloodied the idyllic coastline of Sydneyâ€™s eastern suburbs. The victims: young gay men. Disturbing gang assaults were being carried out on coastal cliffs around Sydney, and mysterious deaths officially recorded as "suicide", "disappearance" and "misadventure". Individual stories are woven together by first person interviews and detailed re-enactments, piecing together the facts of these unsolved cases, decades later.
